catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 824
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: crane standing on tortoise with fringed tail; crane's neck bent down, holding frond of lotus in its mouth; stem extends upward with two flat leaves, a small bud, and open blossom with spike for candle
text: The crane and the tortoise, which here form the base and body of a candlestick, are both symbols of longevity. The crane is said to live for a thousand years and the tortoise for ten-thousand. Candle stands such as this one served as Buddhist ritual implements.
title: Candlestand of a crane on a long-tailed tortoise
